sentences: Tüdrukul on juuksed paelaga taha seotud.
Mind ei seo nende inimestega miski.
context: The Estonian word 'seotud' is the past participle form of the verb 'siduma'. It has multiple meanings including: 1) physically connected or tied together with ropes, strings, etc.; 2) linked or associated with something/someone; 3) engaged or busy (with work); 4) bound by obligations or commitments. The word can refer to both physical connections and abstract relationships or associations.
